treatment.description: Stems commonly elongate and creeping, sometimes compact and short-creeping or not creeping, glabrous or sparsely hairy; internodes usually 1+ mm. Leaf blades narrowly oblance-olate to lanceolate, 3.5–7(–10) mm, herbaceous, those of fertile shoots ciliate along proximal margins, adaxial surface usually white-pilose on proximal 1/5–1/3. Flowers: calyx pinkish; corolla lobes 3–5 mm. 2n = 12.
treatment.habitat: Pine savannas and barrens (commonly with Pinus rigida, sometimes with Quercus marilandica and Q
treatment.discussion: There are no current or historical records of Pyxidanthera barbulata from Delaware or Maryland, where habitats exist that seem comparable to those where the species occurs north and south.
Pyxidanthera barbulata is in the Center for Plant Conservation’s National Collection of Endangered Plants.
